alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 12 at 10:09PM AKST until January 13 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting to 40 mph will create whiteout conditions. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast, mainly around Point Lay. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions have improved some at Point Lay, but bear zero visibility will continue near Wainwright and Atqasuk.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
